item.title: #TIL 2018-04-10 : Create tiny chat channel via netcat
item.description: Create tiny chat channel via netcat In a network, you can create a tiny chatting channel using netcat. It’s lightweight TCP protocol with plain-text transmission, so be carefully on using. First, create a channel by picking port number (ex: 7777) $ sudo nc -l 0.0.0.0 7777 Then, tell you friend your IP and channel port. He will use this info to connect the channel $ nc 192.168.1.2 7777 Finnally, start chatting !

item.title: #TIL 2018-04-10 : Send a file through networking via netcat
item.description: Send a file through networking via netcat If you’re working on 2 machines in same networking and want to send a file from machine A to machine B. But you don’t have USB, floopy disk :lol: or insanse Bluetooth. There is simple way to send a file to another computer without setting up SSH or SMB (althrough these way are safer than it). On the machine A (with IP address : 192.
